title: The future of materials - Deloitte
summary: Eastman Chemical Company, founded in 1920, is working to address the triple challenge of climate change, the global water crisis, and caring for the global population. Eastman has developed two chemical-recycling projects to recycle most complex waste plastics and PET into syngas, acetic acid, and other acetyls, building blocks for advanced materials, additives, and fibers. Eastman's chemical recycling processes are estimated to reduce GHG emissions by 20%–50% compared to processes using fossil fuels.
